alert.note: Alert for Harrison; Shelby (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 13 at 3:16PM CST until January 14 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TUESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. For the Winter Storm Warning, blowing snow. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...In Iowa, Harrison and Shelby Counties. In Nebraska, Washington County. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until noon CST Tuesday. For the Winter Storm Warning, until 6 PM CST this evening. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until midnight CST tonight. * IMPACTS...Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. Visibilities may drop below 1/4 mile in open areas due to falling snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Persons should consider delaying all travel. If travel is absolutely necessary, drive with extreme caution. Consider taking a winter storm kit along with you, including such items as tire chains, booster cables, flashlight, shovel, blankets and extra clothing. Also take water, a first aid kit, and anything else that would help you survive in case you become stranded.
